page.title: 07OLD PLACE NAMES
page.content: There are many old Cornish named places.Here are a few of them in old Cornish:Camelford=ford across the (river)with a bent estuary, Meadowcroft = a piece of rock in the middle of a field. Valley Truckle= tucking mill Cornwall = Kernow. Lanteglos = a church in a valley. There are many others as well. These places are all in in our D-block.Some of the names are very different from 1086. I have been researching them in an old Cornish dictionary. Cornish is not used any more because English was the language used in business, in law and in the church. Cornish has not been spoken for 100 years,although a few odd words are still used.
